pageTitle: FIX: The private bytes of the application continuously increase when an application calls the WlanGetAvailableNetworkList function and the WlanFreeMemory function on a Windows XP Service Pack 2-based computer
textBeforeTable: Expand this table Collapse this table Date and Time item in Control Panel. Time Zone tab in the The English version of this hotfix has the file attributes (or later file attributes) that are listed in the following table. The dates and times for these files are listed in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). When you view the file information, it is converted to local time. To find the difference between UTC and local time, use the loadTOCNode(3, 'resolution'); This hotfix does not replace any other hotfixes. loadTOCNode(3, 'resolution'); You do not have to restart the computer after you apply this hotfix. loadTOCNode(3, 'resolution'); You must have Windows XP SP2 installed to apply this hotfix. loadTOCNode(3, 'resolution');
textAfterTable: Back to the top | Give Feedback STATUS Microsoft has confirmed that this is a problem in the Microsoft products that are listed in the "Applies to" section. Back to the top | Give Feedback MORE INFORMATION The WlanGetAvailableNetworkList function allocates the memory for the returned interfaces. The caller of the WlanGetAvailableNetworkList function is responsible for freeing the memory by using the WlanFreeMemory function. For more information about the WlanGetAvailableNetworkList function, visit the following Microsoft Developer Network (MSDN) Web site: http://msdn2.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms706749.aspx (http://msdn2.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms706749.aspx) For more information about the WlanFreeMemory function, visit the following MSDN Web site: http://msdn2.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms706722.aspx (http://msdn2.microsoft.com/en-us/library/ms706722.aspx) For more information about the update that is described in Microsoft Knowledge Base article 918997, click the following article number to view the article in the Microsoft Knowledge Base: 918997 (https://support.microsoft.com/kb/918997/ ) Developers cannot create wireless client programs that manage wireless profiles and connections over the Wireless Zero Configuration service in Microsoft
